cache_inode_lookup.c

Go to the documentation of this file.

00095 #include "LRU_List.h"
00096 #include "log_functions.h"
00097 #include "HashData.h"
00098 #include "HashTable.h"
00099 #include "fsal.h"
00100 #include "cache_inode.h"
00101 #include "stuff_alloc.h"

00103 #include <unistd.h>
00104 #include <sys/types.h>
00105 #include <sys/param.h>
00106 #include <time.h>
00107 #include <pthread.h>
00108 
00128 cache_entry_t * cache_inode_lookup_sw( cache_entry_t        * pentry_parent,
00129                                        fsal_name_t          * pname, 
00130                                        fsal_attrib_list_t   * pattr, 
00131                                        hash_table_t         * ht,  
00132                                        cache_inode_client_t * pclient, 
00133                                        fsal_op_context_t          * pcontext, 
00134                                        cache_inode_status_t * pstatus,
00135                                        int                    use_mutex )
00136 {
00137   cache_entry_t         * pdir_chain = NULL ;
00138   cache_entry_t         * pentry = NULL ;
00139   fsal_status_t           fsal_status ;
00140 #ifdef _USE_MFSL
00141   mfsl_object_t           object_handle ;
00142 #else
00143   fsal_handle_t           object_handle ;
00144 #endif
00145   fsal_handle_t           dir_handle ;
00146   fsal_attrib_list_t      object_attributes ;
00147   cache_inode_create_arg_t create_arg;
00148   cache_inode_file_type_t type ;
00149   cache_inode_status_t    cache_status ;
00150   
00151 
00152   cache_inode_fsal_data_t  new_entry_fsdata ;
00153   int i = 0 ;
00154 
00155   /* Set the return default to CACHE_INODE_SUCCESS */
00156   *pstatus = CACHE_INODE_SUCCESS ;
00157 
00158   /* stats */
00159   pclient->stat.nb_call_total += 1 ;
00160   pclient->stat.func_stats.nb_call[CACHE_INODE_LOOKUP] += 1 ;
00161 
00162 
00163   /* Get lock on the pentry */
00164   if( use_mutex == TRUE )
00165     P_r( &pentry_parent->lock ) ;
00166   
00167   if( pentry_parent->internal_md.type != DIR_BEGINNING &&
00168       pentry_parent->internal_md.type != DIR_CONTINUE )
00169     {
00170       /* Parent is no directory base, return NULL */
00171       *pstatus = CACHE_INODE_NOT_A_DIRECTORY ;
00172 
00173       /* stats */
00174       pclient->stat.func_stats.nb_err_unrecover[CACHE_INODE_LOOKUP] += 1 ;
00175       
00176       if( use_mutex == TRUE )
00177         V_r( &pentry_parent->lock ) ;
00178 
00179       return NULL ;
00180     }
00181 
00182   /* if name is ".", use the input value */
00183   if( !FSAL_namecmp( pname,  &FSAL_DOT ) )
00184     {
00185       pentry = pentry_parent ;
00186     }
00187   else if( !FSAL_namecmp( pname, &FSAL_DOT_DOT ) )
00188     {
00189       /* Directory do only have exactly one parent. This a limitation in all FS, which 
00190        * implies that hard link are forbidden on directories (so that they exists only in one dir)
00191        * Because of this, the parent list is always limited to one element for a dir.
00192        * Clients SHOULD never 'lookup( .. )' in something that is no dir */
00193       pentry = cache_inode_lookupp_no_mutex( pentry_parent, ht, pclient, pcontext, pstatus ) ;
00194     }
00195   else
00196     {
00197       /* This is a "regular lookup" (not on "." or "..") */
00198       
00199       /* Check is user (as specified by the credentials) is authorized to lookup the directory or not */
00200       if( cache_inode_access_no_mutex( pentry_parent, 
00201                                        FSAL_X_OK,
00202                                        ht,
00203                                        pclient,
00204                                        pcontext,
00205                                        pstatus ) != CACHE_INODE_SUCCESS )
00206         {
00207           if( use_mutex == TRUE )
00208             V_r( &pentry_parent->lock ) ;
00209           
00210           pclient->stat.func_stats.nb_err_retryable[CACHE_INODE_GETATTR] += 1 ;
00211           return NULL ;
00212         }
00213 
00214       /* Try to look into the dir and its dir_cont. At this point, it must be said than lock on dir_cont are
00215        *  taken when a lock is previously acquired on the related dir_begin */
00216       pdir_chain = pentry_parent ;
00217       
00218       do
00219         {
00220           /* Is this entry known ? */
00221           if( pdir_chain->internal_md.type == DIR_BEGINNING )
00222             {
00223               for( i = 0 ; i < CHILDREN_ARRAY_SIZE ; i++ )
00224                 {
00225                   if( pdir_chain->object.dir_begin.pdir_data->dir_entries[i].active == VALID )
00226                     if( !FSAL_namecmp( pname,  
00227                                        &(pentry_parent->object.dir_begin.pdir_data->dir_entries[i].name) ) )
00228                       {
00229                         /* Entry was found */
00230                         pentry = pentry_parent->object.dir_begin.pdir_data->dir_entries[i].pentry ;
00231                         DisplayLogJdLevel( pclient->log_outputs, NIV_FULL_DEBUG, "Cache Hit detected (dir_begin)" ) ;
00232                         break ;
00233                       }    
00234                 }
00235               
00236               /* Do we have to go on browsing the cache_inode ? */
00237               if( pdir_chain->object.dir_begin.end_of_dir == END_OF_DIR ) 
00238                 {
00239                   break ;
00240                 }
00241               
00242               /* Next step */
00243               pdir_chain = pdir_chain->object.dir_begin.pdir_cont ;
00244             }
00245           else
00246             {
00247               /* The element in the dir_chain is a DIR_CONTINUE */
00248               for( i = 0 ; i < CHILDREN_ARRAY_SIZE ; i++ )
00249                 {
00250                   if( pdir_chain->object.dir_cont.pdir_data->dir_entries[i].active == VALID )
00251                     if( !FSAL_namecmp( pname,  
00252                                        &(pdir_chain->object.dir_cont.pdir_data->dir_entries[i].name) ) ) 
00253                       {
00254                         /* Entry was found */
00255                         pentry = pdir_chain->object.dir_cont.pdir_data->dir_entries[i].pentry ;
00256                         DisplayLogJdLevel( pclient->log_outputs, NIV_FULL_DEBUG, "Cache Hit detected (dir_cont)" ) ;
00257                         break ;
00258                       }    
00259                 }
00260               
00261               /* Do we have to go on browsing the cache_inode ? */
00262               if( pdir_chain->object.dir_cont.end_of_dir == END_OF_DIR ) 
00263                 {
00264                   break ;
00265                 }
00266 
00267               /* Next step */
00268               pdir_chain = pdir_chain->object.dir_cont.pdir_cont ;
00269             }
00270           
00271         } while( pentry == NULL ) ;
00272       
00273       /* At this point, if pentry == NULL, we are not looking for a known son, query fsal for lookup */
00274       if( pentry == NULL )
00275         {
00276           DisplayLogJdLevel( pclient->log_outputs, NIV_FULL_DEBUG, "Cache Miss detected" ) ;
00277           
00278           if( pentry_parent->internal_md.type == DIR_BEGINNING )
00279             dir_handle = pentry_parent->object.dir_begin.handle ;
00280           
00281           if( pentry_parent->internal_md.type == DIR_CONTINUE )
00282             {
00283               if( use_mutex == TRUE )
00284                 P_r( &pentry_parent->object.dir_cont.pdir_begin->lock ) ;
00285               
00286               dir_handle = pentry_parent->object.dir_cont.pdir_begin->object.dir_begin.handle ;
00287               
00288               if( use_mutex == TRUE )
00289                 V_r( &pentry_parent->object.dir_cont.pdir_begin->lock ) ;
00290             }
00291           
00292           object_attributes.asked_attributes = pclient->attrmask ;
00293 #ifdef _USE_MFSL
00294           fsal_status = MFSL_lookup( &pentry_parent->mobject, 
00295                                      pname, 
00296                                      pcontext, 
00297                                      &pclient->mfsl_context, 
00298                                      &object_handle, 
00299                                      &object_attributes ) ;
00300 #else
00301           fsal_status = FSAL_lookup( &dir_handle, pname, pcontext, &object_handle, &object_attributes ) ;
00302 #endif
00303           
00304           if( FSAL_IS_ERROR( fsal_status ) ) 
00305             {
00306               *pstatus = cache_inode_error_convert( fsal_status ) ;
00307 
00308               if( use_mutex == TRUE )
00309                 V_r( &pentry_parent->lock ) ;
00310               
00311               /* Stale File Handle to be detected and managed */
00312               if( fsal_status.major == ERR_FSAL_STALE ) 
00313                {
00314                  cache_inode_status_t kill_status ;
00315 
00316                  DisplayLog( "cache_inode_lookup: Stale FSAL File Handle detected for pentry = %p", pentry_parent ) ;
00317 
00318                  if( cache_inode_kill_entry( pentry_parent, ht, pclient, &kill_status ) != CACHE_INODE_SUCCESS ) 
00319                     DisplayLog( "cache_inode_pentry_parent: Could not kill entry %p, status = %u", pentry_parent, kill_status ) ;
00320 
00321                  *pstatus = CACHE_INODE_FSAL_ESTALE ;
00322                }
00323 
00324               /* stats */
00325               pclient->stat.func_stats.nb_err_unrecover[CACHE_INODE_LOOKUP] += 1 ;
00326               
00327               return NULL ;
00328             }
00329           
00330           type = cache_inode_fsal_type_convert( object_attributes.type ) ;
00331           
00332           /* If entry is a symlink, this value for be cached */
00333           if( type == SYMBOLIC_LINK )
00334             {
00335 #ifdef _USE_MFSL
00336               fsal_status = MFSL_readlink( &object_handle, pcontext, &pclient->mfsl_context, &create_arg.link_content, &object_attributes  ) ;
00337 #else
00338               fsal_status = FSAL_readlink( &object_handle, pcontext, &create_arg.link_content, &object_attributes  ) ;
00339 #endif
00340               if( FSAL_IS_ERROR( fsal_status ) ) 
00341                 { 
00342                   *pstatus = cache_inode_error_convert( fsal_status ) ;
00343                   if( use_mutex == TRUE )
00344                     V_r( &pentry_parent->lock ) ;
00345                  
00346                    /* Stale File Handle to be detected and managed */
00347                    if( fsal_status.major == ERR_FSAL_STALE )
00348                     {
00349                       cache_inode_status_t kill_status ;
00350 
00351                       DisplayLog( "cache_inode_lookup: Stale FSAL File Handle detected for pentry = %p", pentry_parent ) ;
00352 
00353                       if( cache_inode_kill_entry( pentry_parent, ht, pclient, &kill_status ) != CACHE_INODE_SUCCESS )
00354                          DisplayLog( "cache_inode_pentry_parent: Could not kill entry %p, status = %u", pentry_parent, kill_status ) ;
00355 
00356                        *pstatus = CACHE_INODE_FSAL_ESTALE ;
00357                     }
00358  
00359                   /* stats */
00360                   pclient->stat.func_stats.nb_err_unrecover[CACHE_INODE_LOOKUP] += 1 ;
00361                   
00362                   return NULL ;
00363                 }
00364             }
00365           
00366           /* Allocation of a new entry in the cache */
00367 #ifdef _USE_MFSL
00368           new_entry_fsdata.handle = object_handle.handle ;
00369 #else
00370           new_entry_fsdata.handle = object_handle ;
00371 #endif
00372           new_entry_fsdata.cookie = 0 ;
00373           
00374           
00375           if( ( pentry = cache_inode_new_entry( &new_entry_fsdata, 
00376                                                 &object_attributes, 
00377                                                 type, 
00378                                                 &create_arg,
00379                                                 NULL, 
00380                                                 ht, 
00381                                                 pclient, 
00382                                                 pcontext, 
00383                                                 FALSE, /* This is a population and not a creation */
00384                                                 pstatus ) ) == NULL )
00385             {
00386               if( use_mutex == TRUE )
00387                 V_r( &pentry_parent->lock ) ;
00388               
00389               /* stats */
00390               pclient->stat.func_stats.nb_err_unrecover[CACHE_INODE_LOOKUP] += 1 ;
00391               
00392               return NULL ;
00393             }
00394           
00395           /* Entry was found in the FSAL, add this entry to the parent directory */
00396           cache_status = cache_inode_add_cached_dirent( pentry_parent,
00397                                                         pname, 
00398                                                         pentry,
00399                                                         NULL,
00400                                                         ht, 
00401                                                         pclient, 
00402                                                         pcontext,
00403                                                         pstatus) ;
00404           
00405           if( cache_status != CACHE_INODE_SUCCESS && cache_status != CACHE_INODE_ENTRY_EXISTS )
00406             {
00407               if( use_mutex == TRUE )
00408                 V_r( &pentry_parent->lock ) ;
00409               
00410               /* stats */
00411               pclient->stat.func_stats.nb_err_unrecover[CACHE_INODE_LOOKUP] += 1 ;
00412               
00413               return NULL ;
00414             }
00415           
00416         }
00417     }
00418 
00419   /* Return the attributes */
00420   cache_inode_get_attributes( pentry, pattr ) ;
00421   
00422   
00423   *pstatus =  cache_inode_valid( pentry_parent, CACHE_INODE_OP_GET, pclient ) ;
00424   
00425   if( use_mutex == TRUE )
00426     V_r( &pentry_parent->lock ) ;
00427 
00428   /* stat */
00429   if( *pstatus != CACHE_INODE_SUCCESS )
00430     pclient->stat.func_stats.nb_err_retryable[CACHE_INODE_LOOKUP] += 1 ;
00431   else
00432     pclient->stat.func_stats.nb_success[CACHE_INODE_LOOKUP] += 1 ;
00433   
00434   return pentry ;
00435 } /* cache_inode_lookup_sw */
00436 
00456 cache_entry_t * cache_inode_lookup_no_mutex( cache_entry_t        * pentry_parent,
00457                                              fsal_name_t          * pname, 
00458                                              fsal_attrib_list_t   * pattr, 
00459                                              hash_table_t         * ht,  
00460                                              cache_inode_client_t * pclient, 
00461                                              fsal_op_context_t          * pcontext, 
00462                                              cache_inode_status_t * pstatus )
00463 {
00464   return cache_inode_lookup_sw(  pentry_parent,
00465                                  pname, 
00466                                  pattr, 
00467                                  ht,
00468                                  pclient, 
00469                                  pcontext, 
00470                                  pstatus,
00471                                  FALSE ) ;
00472 } /* cache_inode_lookup_no_mutex */

00493 cache_entry_t * cache_inode_lookup( cache_entry_t        * pentry_parent,
00494                                     fsal_name_t          * pname, 
00495                                     fsal_attrib_list_t   * pattr, 
00496                                     hash_table_t         * ht,  
00497                                     cache_inode_client_t * pclient, 
00498                                     fsal_op_context_t          * pcontext, 
00499                                     cache_inode_status_t * pstatus )
00500 {
00501   return cache_inode_lookup_sw(  pentry_parent,
00502                                  pname, 
00503                                  pattr, 
00504                                  ht,
00505                                  pclient, 
00506                                  pcontext, 
00507                                  pstatus,
00508                                  TRUE ) ;
00509 } /* cache_inode_lookup */
